intro: Omphalocarpum radlkoferi, commonly known as the yellow burr grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiny pods that contain seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of study in ecological and taxonomic research.
